topic.title: How to Copy Additional Resources to Output Directory

indexterm.product: author developer editor authorEclipse developerEclipse editorEclipse

keywords.indexterm: WebHelp Responsive Copy resources to output directory

body.p: You can copy additional resources (such as graphics, JavaScript, CSS, entire folders, or other resources) to the output directory either by using an Oxygen Publishing Template or the webhelp.custom.resources parameter.

section.title: Copying Additional Resources to the Output Directory using a Publishing Template

ol.li: If you haven't already created a Publishing Template, see .

Add a new fileset element in the resources section of the template descriptor file.<publishing-template> ... <webhelp> ... <resources> <fileset> <include name="custom-resources/**/*"/> <exclude name="**/*.git"/> </fileset>Relative paths in the descriptor file are relative to the template root folder.
Open the DITA Map WebHelp Responsive transformation scenario.
Click the Choose Custom Publishing Template link and select your template.
Click OK to save the changes to the transformation scenario.

section.p: Results: All files from the custom resources directory will be copied to the /oxygen-webhelp/template folder.

section.title: Copying Additional Resources to the Output Directory using a Transformation Parameter

ol.li: Place all your resources in the same directory.
Edit the DITA Map WebHelp Responsive transformation scenario and open the Parameters tab.
Edit the value of the webhelp.custom.resources parameter and set it to the absolute path of the directory in step 1.
Click OK to save the changes to the transformation scenario.

section.p: Results: All files from the new directory will be copied to the root of the WebHelp output directory.
